title: Technological Infrastructure of Institutional Capture Networks
description:
Comprehensive research analyzing the systematic use of advanced technological infrastructure to facilitate institutional capture. Investigate AI-driven personnel selection, predictive analytics for ideological alignment, and digital surveillance technologies enabling institutional transformation.

Research Objectives:
- Analyze machine learning mechanisms for mapping institutional networks
- Document predictive analytics in candidate selection
- Investigate digital surveillance technologies in governance structures
- Assess AI's role in strategic personnel positioning
primary_researchers: Center for Technology and Democracy, Georgetown University
Harvard Berkman Klein Center for Internet & Society
notes: Critical investigation into technological mechanisms of institutional transformation. Requires interdisciplinary approach combining technology, governance, and social network analysis.
